info.name: Maestro API
info.description: Maestro authors and executes experiences that allow non-coders the ability to define Simple Business Process without having to write code and to deploy them seamlessly without having to have development expertise

item.name: Triggers a new instance of the workflow.

query.description: Managed Token Id registered with Docusign Account Server
Managed Token Secret registered with Docusign account server

request.description:
Creates a new workflow instance, triggering the workflow.

### Related topics

- [How to trigger a Maestro workflow](/docs/maestro-api/how-to/trigger-workflow/)

response.name: Returns a workflow instance trigger URL that can be used to trigger a new instance or return to an instance in progress

item.name: Get a list of instances of a deployed workflow definition.

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the workflow definition to delete.

request.description:
Get a list of instances of a deployed workflow definition.

A successful response is an array of 
[`WorkflowInstance`](/docs/maestro-api/reference/workflowinstancemanagement/workflowinstancemanagement/getworkflowinstance/#schema_200_workflowinstance_workflowinstance)
objects.

response.name: A list of workflow instances for a workflow definition in the specified account.
The requested resource was not found

Workflow definition metadata status. <!-- filter -->
Workflow definition metadata status. <!-- filter -->

request.description:
Creates a workflow definition. In general, it is much easier to create a workflow through the web interface.

A Maestro workflow is an object that represents your end-to-end agreement workflow, including all pre and post-signing steps. You can add and order steps as necessary for your workflow and add conditional logic to create branches within that workflow. 

To learn the basics of workflows and to see an example workflow definition,
see [Workflows](/docs/maestro-api/maestro101/workflows/) in
the Maestro API concepts guide.

response.name: The requested resource was not found

variable.description: (Required) The ID of the workflow definition to delete.

request.description:
Updates a workflow definition.

A Maestro workflow is an object that represents your end-to-end agreement workflow, including all pre and post-signing steps. You can add and order steps as necessary for your workflow and add conditional logic to create branches within that workflow.

To learn the basics of workflows and to see an example workflow definition,
see [Workflows](/docs/maestro-api/maestro101/workflows/) in
the Maestro API concepts guide.
